alert.note: Alert for East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 8:06PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Niobrara, northwestern Goshen and northeastern Platte Counties through 830 PM MDT... At 805 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Rawhide Buttes to 12 miles southeast of Chugwater. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Guernsey, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Yoder, Jay Em, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Grayrocks Reservoir, Guernsey Campground, Rawhide Buttes, Veteran, Slater and Hartville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: East Platte County; Goshen County; Niobrara County
